The essence of my research is not destruction, but "reduction." I return objects to their most fundamental particles, then reconstruct them according to my will.
This is the true realm of creation, something the stagnant minds of Arcanum could never imagine.

With my touch, the stars above gather and dance, with the scattered forces of creation joining like dew beneath the moonlight.

As the celestial stars align and sing in harmony, my eyes will once again capture the primordial light of creation.

St_L_MentalCorruption.shortDescription: Dark damage over time until death
St_L_MentalCorruption.description: Corrupts the minds of the target and those around them, dealing <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>200%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Dark damage</color> and <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>60%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Dark damage</color> every 0.5 seconds until death.

St_L_MentalCorruption.name: Mental Corruption
St_L_MentalCorruption.lore:
As I wander through this world, I sometimes meet people who are aware of the dream world. A rare few remember our encounters completely, allowing us to keep connecting again and again.

One day, while speaking with one of them as usual, I noticed the light suddenly fade from their eyes. That empty gaze was fixed on me.

"Is she truly happy here?"

Suddenly, he called out to me with a question.

"Or is she merely a beautiful doll trapped in your perfect cage?"

In that moment, my world shook. A wave of fear froze my heart. As if my anxiety were contagious, everyone around us began to warp, their hidden hatred and fear for each other rising to the surface.

With my power, I erased the source of that corruption, leaving not a single trace behind. Like an illusion, the chaos vanished, and the world slipped back into its false tranquility. But I saw it. In the shadows, something unseen was mocking my deepest self.

No. This utopia is mine. My wife... my family must be real. I cannot lose them again.

I will make sure this never happens again. No cracks, no doubts.

Never again, will I allow it.

But the world as the girl saw it was, at times, terribly twisted. 

When the old book in her mind imagined mischievous stories, 
fragments of distorted thoughts poured down from the sky like black rain. 

Those caught in this rain 
became trapped in the darkest chamber of the mind.

St_C_Whirlwind.lore:
Excerpt from the Chronicles of the Forgotten Snowy Mountain:

In the days before the great mountain was broken, giant children played a game called "Chasing the Blizzard." Each child would carry a small wooden axe, mimicking their ruler, Skoll. His wild, spinning destruction appeared to them as a hero's dance and a song of glory.

The children would spin around until they collapsed from dizziness, dreaming that one day they too might protect the mountain as the great storm itself.

No one knew.

The hero's dance they so admired would become the very storm that shattered their world. The song of glory they sang would turn into the mountain's dirge.

St_C_MagicSword.description: Dash forward briefly and swing the Teal Blade, dealing <color=yellow>damage</color> to enemies in front. Deals the greater of <sprite=2><color=#FF8A2D>200%</color><sprite=5> or <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>200%</color><sprite=5>, and triggers <color=yellow>attack effects</color> if your <color=yellow>Attack Damage</color> is higher.
St_C_MagicSword.rawDesc: Dash forward briefly and swing the Teal Blade, dealing <color=yellow>damage</color> to enemies in front. Deals the greater of {0} or {1}, and triggers <color=yellow>attack effects</color> if your <color=yellow>Attack Damage</color> is higher.
St_C_MagicSword.name: Teal Blade
St_C_MagicSword.lore:
In the quiet dawn,
when I visit the back garden of Highgate Manor,
a memory rises, unbidden.

The cool air of the old training hall, still brushing against my cheek.
My childhood self, casting only the smallest of shadows.
Mother's voice, sharp as frost.

The Teal Blade.
The family sword—strength and pride of House Verdesilver.
Like a steadfast tree, straight and unwavering,
Mother showed me the blade that day.

But my sword could not follow her teachings.
The tip trembled like a leaf dancing in the wind, and my strength flowed away like water.

Isn't it ironic, Mother?
The proud tree you fought so hard to protect has fallen and broken,
while this worthless leaf, scattered by the wind,
is the one that survived.

Now the family's pride is gone, the weight of the tree lifted...
but I have no regrets.

All I wish for now is...
to wield this blade as a nameless mist that has lost its teal,
for the happiness of my younger sibling.

St_R_Immolation.shortDescription: Sacrifice Health, deal Fire damage to nearby enemies

While burning, your <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> increases by 20%<sprite=5> and you deal <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>165%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Fire damage</color> per second to nearby enemies.
St_R_Immolation.rawDesc: Ignite your body, sacrificing {0} of your current Health over {1} seconds. While burning, your <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> increases by {2} and you deal {3} <color=yellow>Fire damage</color> per second to nearby enemies.
St_R_Immolation.name: Immolation
St_R_Immolation.lore:
This frail, weary body will soon become the last shackle that binds me.
Though I have wandered through poverty and pain all my life, not once did I doubt Him. The priest of the Order said, "The purest souls burn themselves to cast off the chains of flesh, and only then can they become light that reaches El'pyros."

I am not afraid.
Rather, I am grateful. That the final moment of this painful life could be so glorious... what greater mercy could there be?

There, I can see the Solar Spire. Soon, I too will become part of that light.
Oh, radiant sun!


- Memory trace from a small burnt body near the Solar Spire.

St_Q_SuperNova.rawDesc: Creates an expanding star at the target location that slows enemies, then channels for up to {0} seconds. You can't attack or use Memories while channeling. Stars burn their very essence to shine their brightest,
only for that moment to signal the start of eternal silence.

St_R_RepulsiveShield.description: Blocks damage from enemies in front for 1.9<sprite=5> seconds. Each time damage is blocked, deals <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>240%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>damage</color> to up to 4 enemies in front.

St_R_RepulsiveShield.lore:
"Come on, give it all you've got."

"You sure?"

"Yes, go for it!"

The man swung his sword with all his might, only for it to crash against a shield with a resounding metallic clang.

At the same time, a slash mark appeared on the tree behind him.

"What in the world...?"

"Haha, did you see that? I'm invincible now!"


- A memory snippet from a soldier with a scar on the back of his head.

Nachia gives this ancient blessing to those she protects.

St_E_Rewind.lore:
Someone's fierce regret and relentless drive.
A desperate wish to turn back time and correct past mistakes.
And the lingering memories of the one who brought this desire to life.

St_QR_ValiantHeart.description: Swing a magical sword at the nearest enemies, dealing <sprite=2><color=#FF8A2D>300%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>damage</color> and slightly knocking them back. When the sword hits an enemy, Bismuth's <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> increases by 15%<sprite=5> for 1 seconds.
St_QR_ValiantHeart.rawDesc: Swing a magical sword at the nearest enemies, dealing {0} <color=yellow>damage</color> and slightly knocking them back. When the sword hits an enemy, Bismuth's <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> increases by {1} for {2} seconds.
St_QR_ValiantHeart.name: Valiant Heart
St_QR_ValiantHeart.lore:
The girl firmly believed she was the brave protagonist of a story she was writing herself. 

'Sword of courage, appear!' 

When the girl shouted, 
the old book placed a shining piece of story in her hand. 

When people saw the gleaming sword, they suddenly cried out and rushed toward her. 
They were all villains hiding their wicked hearts! 

'Take this, villains!' 

The girl bravely cut them down one by one with her sword!

St_Q_EtherealInfluence.lore:
Behold, this most fundamental substance.
From your soul to the earth beneath your feet, it is the beginning and end of all existence.
Like the first breath of the universe itself...

St_D_AstridsMasterpiecePriorite.lore: I will never give up. For you, Astrid...

St_R_PillarOfFlame.rawDesc: Summons a pillar of fire at the target location, immediately dealing {0} <color=yellow>Fire damage</color> to all enemies within the area, then deals {1} <color=yellow>Fire damage</color> over {2} seconds.

St_QR_InfernalTales.description: Creates a ring of flames around you for 3 seconds. Enemies touching the flame ring take <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>350%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Fire damage</color> per second.
St_QR_InfernalTales.rawDesc: Creates a ring of flames around you for {0} seconds. Enemies touching the flame ring take {1} <color=yellow>Fire damage</color> per second.
St_QR_InfernalTales.name: Tales of Hellfire
St_QR_InfernalTales.lore:
One day, the girl read a story about a mighty dragon. 

"I want to be strong like a dragon too!" 

As she thought this, 
the old book cheerfully turned its pages. 

Soon, flames like a dragon's hot breath rose from the girl's body, 
and everyone around her smiled more brightly than any star as they danced with her.

Enemies inside the sigil take <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>150%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>damage</color> per second, and allies inside heal for <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>44%</color><sprite=5> Health per second for each enemy inside. When hitting a <color=yellow>boss</color>, <color=yellow>damage</color> and <color=yellow>healing</color> are increased by 200%.

This is perfect proof of my theory.
Decomposition and combination trigger one another, creating a chain reaction according to the laws I have established.
There are countless ways to use this power, depending on how it is shaped.

I must continue my research.

St_C_SparklingWaterGun.lore:
Backstreet Tips #5:

Ingredients: Nettles you find along the roadside, and a poisonous herb with red-tipped leaves (don't know the name).
Preparation: Grind them up in a stone mortar and mix with water.
Use: Perfect for leaving stains on the fancy cloaks of those pretentious nobles. If any touch their skin, they will be dealing with a tingling itch for days. Consider that a little bonus.
Analysis: There's nothing better for getting under their skin.

For rats like us, this is the only way to tug at the cat's whiskers. Life is precious, after all.

The tentacles attach to enemies, dealing <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>80%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>damage</color> and an additional <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>200%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>damage</color> to pulled enemies.

When this Memory is empowered, the <color=yellow>number of enemies</color> pulled and the <color=yellow>area of effect</color> increase.
St_E_ClutchesOfMalice.name: Clutches of Malice
St_E_ClutchesOfMalice.lore:
How many days have I been lost in this twisted dream world?
As my sense of time dulled, something began to take shape before my eyes.
Beyond the mist, "I" was standing there.

At first I was merely curious, but the moment I met its gaze, I realized what writhed in those depths was not my soul, but something strange and damp. It was fear itself.
As it slowly reached toward me, its back split open and blood-red tentacles burst forth. At their ends hung not just pieces of flesh, but living eyeballs, staring intently at me like seeds planted to spread this nightmare across the world.
Only then did I understand. That was not my reflection in a mirror. It was a hungry clutch of nightmares, using me as a host and seeking to consume this world.


- Memory trace engraved in someone's fragment

St_E_UmbralEdge.description: For 7 seconds, imbues your weapon with the power of darkness, increasing <color=yellow>Critical Strike Chance</color> by 20%<sprite=5> and dealing <sprite=2><color=#FF8A2D>52%</color><sprite=5> additional <color=yellow>Dark damage</color> on <color=yellow>attack</color>. <color=yellow>Melee Travelers</color> deal 25% increased additional damage.
St_E_UmbralEdge.rawDesc: For {0} seconds, imbues your weapon with the power of darkness, increasing <color=yellow>Critical Strike Chance</color> by {1} and dealing {2} additional <color=yellow>Dark damage</color> on <color=yellow>attack</color>. <color=yellow>Melee Travelers</color> deal {3} increased additional damage.
St_E_UmbralEdge.name: Umbral Edge
St_E_UmbralEdge.lore:
After hearing rumors about Shangri-La, I returned to the Puppeteer's workshop.

The abandoned corpses remained, and the ruins carried their familiar stench. My memory tells me this is where the tragedy that took everything from me began. Yet my body and mind showed no reaction, just as I expected.

I wasn't here for sentimentality. I had another purpose. Amidst the ruins, I found traces of a memory, seemingly hidden by the Puppeteer.

It was the memory of a swordsman I did not know, carrying a foreign blade, not of eastern origin. He was not simply cutting; he had captured the abyss within his sword and wielded the void itself.

A strange sense of kinship came over me. I understood that sword. It was a kind of emptiness that only those with hollow souls could inhabit.

St_R_Smite.shortDescription: Deal heavy Light damage to target

St_R_Smite.name: Lightning Strike
St_R_Smite.lore:
The Society appears to be filled with elders stuck in their ways, their thinking growing fragile and stagnant. How long will they tinker with trivial rules, basking in their so-called achievements?

Observing the tree scorched by lightning last night sparked an idea. Even such immense natural power must operate under certain laws, doesn't it?

If I can uncover these laws, I might be able to wield that force. Just the thought of it is thrilling. I must begin my research immediately.

St_D_CircleOfLife.lore: The only law Nachia believes in is the Cycle of Life. She dedicated herself to guarding the natural order, where flowers bloom, wither, and bloom again, all according to providence. But the providence she trusted was shattered when her younger sibling was overtaken by madness.

St_U_WorldCracker.description: Channels a powerful beam that deals <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>575%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light damage</color> per second to all enemies it touches. You can't move while channeling, but can maintain it indefinitely until canceled.

St_U_WorldCracker.lore:
A memory trace of one who was once among the most powerful beings in the world of dreams. It is a fragment of power from one who was king and god of all spirits.

Wielding the authority of divine radiance, he could reduce entire worlds to ashes with a single blow. He challenged the master of worlds but was defeated, and afterward, his whereabouts became unknown. Rumor holds he was imprisoned in another dimension, lost most of his power, and was left as nothing more than an ordinary king.

Yet the whispers told a different story.
They spoke of the symbol of his servitude having disappeared.

St_E_ChainLightning.lore:
-- Experiment Log
-- Day 273 since the experiment began
-- Written by Aurena


A partial success.
I've managed to control the power of lightning to some extent, but it's inherently unstable. The electrical discharge jumps unpredictably to unintended targets.

However, I've stumbled upon something even more significant. I've uncovered an insight into the fundamental power of dreams, but I'm running out of space in this log. For now, I'll refer to this as "Dismantling Force" and continue my research.

Allies are <color=yellow>healed</color> for <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>80%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Health</color> for each <color=yellow>elemental effect</color> removed from them.

St_E_MassCleanse.name: Mass Cleanse
St_E_MassCleanse.lore:
The madness of nightmares is spreading. 
The forest's balance is already severely disrupted.
Diseased branches must be cut away before the entire forest rots and collapses.
What I am about to do is nothing but a cold and resolut cleansing, for the sake of the forest's order, which matters above all else.

The little compassion I have left, at least for this moment, must be set aside.
This is my role and duty as a keeper of the forest.

...

My beloved sibling, I pray that in your presence as well,
I can fulfill my responsibility...

St_Q_SylvanCall.lore:
The purest spirits in the Ethereal Forest are born from fallen leaves and morning dew.
When Nachia, the guardian of the forest, calls out, these strange "hounds" willingly appear to answer her call.

St_Q_Fleche.description:
Dash toward the target, dealing <sprite=2><color=#FF8A2D>140%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>damage</color>, immediately performing a <color=yellow>basic attack</color>, and temporarily increasing <color=yellow>Mist</color>'s <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color>. If this <color=yellow>damage</color> kills the target, restore 15<sprite=5> Health and reduce the <color=yellow>cooldown</color> by 15%.

<color=yellow>Charges</color> are fully restored at once.
St_Q_Fleche.rawDesc:
Dash toward the target, dealing {0} <color=yellow>damage</color>, immediately performing a <color=yellow>basic attack</color>, and temporarily increasing <color=yellow>Mist</color>'s <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color>. If this <color=yellow>damage</color> kills the target, restore {1} Health and reduce the <color=yellow>cooldown</color> by {2}.

St_L_ButchersStrike.shortDescription: Forward damage, collect meat to heal and grow stronger
St_L_ButchersStrike.description:
Swing a blade forward, dealing <sprite=2><color=#FF8A2D>200%</color><sprite=5> damage to enemies and <color=yellow>reducing</color> their <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> by 30% for 2 seconds.

If an enemy hit by the blade dies within 3 seconds, they drop <color=yellow>Meat</color>. Collecting <color=yellow>Meat</color> <color=yellow>restores</color> <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>25%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Health</color> and permanently increases the <color=yellow>damage</color> of Butcher's Strike by 1%.
St_L_ButchersStrike.rawDesc:
Swing a blade forward, dealing {0} damage to enemies and <color=yellow>reducing</color> their <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> by {1} for {2} seconds.

If an enemy hit by the blade dies within {3} seconds, they drop <color=yellow>Meat</color>. Collecting <color=yellow>Meat</color> <color=yellow>restores</color> {4} <color=yellow>Health</color> and permanently increases the <color=yellow>damage</color> of Butcher's Strike by {5}.
St_L_ButchersStrike.name: Butcher's Strike

St_D_BeautifulThreat.shortDescription: Ranged basic attacks, enemy damage, ally healing
St_D_BeautifulThreat.description:
Your <color=yellow>basic attacks</color> become ranged. Casting <color=yellow>any Memory</color> or using <color=yellow>Dodge</color> grants 2 stacks of <color=yellow>Golden Feather</color>, up to a maximum of 6. While you have <color=yellow>Golden Feather</color> stacks, your <color=yellow>Attack Speed</color> is increased by 20%.

When you attack an enemy with feather stacks, one stack is consumed to deal <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>90%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>damage</color> and <color=yellow>heal</color> Aurena for <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>14%</color><sprite=5>. When you heal an ally with feather stacks, one stack is consumed to additionally <color=yellow>heal</color> the target for <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>22%</color><sprite=5>.
St_D_BeautifulThreat.rawDesc:
Your <color=yellow>basic attacks</color> become ranged. Casting <color=yellow>any Memory</color> or using <color=yellow>Dodge</color> grants {0} stacks of <color=yellow>Golden Feather</color>, up to a maximum of {1}. While you have <color=yellow>Golden Feather</color> stacks, your <color=yellow>Attack Speed</color> is increased by {2}.

When you attack an enemy with feather stacks, one stack is consumed to deal {3} <color=yellow>damage</color> and <color=yellow>heal</color> Aurena for {4}. When you heal an ally with feather stacks, one stack is consumed to additionally <color=yellow>heal</color> the target for {5}.
St_D_BeautifulThreat.name: Beautiful Threat
St_D_BeautifulThreat.lore: The golden particles, byproducts of Dismantling Force, crystallize into feather shapes, creating a beautiful and entirely predictable side effect. Each feather, whether used for dismantling or fusion, will serve as the perfect medium for power.

St_R_ShadowWalk.shortDescription: Dash and attack nearby enemies, Dark
St_R_ShadowWalk.description: Quickly dash forward and fire 3 dark shards at nearby enemies. Each shard deals <sprite=2><color=#FF8A2D>65%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Dark damage</color> and triggers 50% <color=yellow>attack effects</color>.
St_R_ShadowWalk.rawDesc: Quickly dash forward and fire {0} dark shards at nearby enemies. Each shard deals {1} <color=yellow>Dark damage</color> and triggers {2} <color=yellow>attack effects</color>.
St_R_ShadowWalk.name: Shadow Walk

St_L_Blizzard.description:
Summons a blizzard in the target area 4<sprite=5> times every 0.7 seconds, dealing <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>180%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Cold Damage</color> to enemies and granting allies a <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>60%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Barrier</color> that fades over 3.5 seconds.
Can maintain up to 10 simultaneously.
St_L_Blizzard.rawDesc:
Summons a blizzard in the target area {0} times every {1} seconds, dealing {2} <color=yellow>Cold Damage</color> to enemies and granting allies a {3} <color=yellow>Barrier</color> that fades over {4} seconds.
Can maintain up to {5} simultaneously.
St_L_Blizzard.name: Blizzard
St_L_Blizzard.lore:
My breath... was stolen away.
Screams froze in the air, and the bone-piercing cold stripped me of all feeling.

That wolf's howl was not of a victor. It was the wail of one who had lost everything, the desperate scream of a shattered kingdom.
And we died beneath that crushing despair, nothing more than dust, choking on our helplessness.
This blizzard is not mere cold.
It carries his despair mixed with my curse, his sorrow swirling with my rage.

This is a living hell.


- Memory trace of a mercenary buried in the Snowy Mountain, moments before death.

St_L_CoinExplosion.description:
Throws a <color=yellow>Coin</color> at the cost of 1% of your current <color=yellow>Gold</color>. The <color=yellow>Coin</color> <color=yellow>explodes</color> upon hitting the first enemy, dealing <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>150%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light damage</color> to enemies and <color=yellow>stunning</color> them for 1 seconds.

After the explosion, there's a 50% chance for the <color=yellow>explosion damage</color> to permanently double, but also a 50% chance to lose all accumulated increases.
St_L_CoinExplosion.rawDesc:
Throws a <color=yellow>Coin</color> at the cost of {0} of your current <color=yellow>Gold</color>. The <color=yellow>Coin</color> <color=yellow>explodes</color> upon hitting the first enemy, dealing {1} <color=yellow>Light damage</color> to enemies and <color=yellow>stunning</color> them for {2} seconds.

After the explosion, there's a 50% chance for the <color=yellow>explosion damage</color> to permanently double, but also a 50% chance to lose all accumulated increases.
St_L_CoinExplosion.name: Coin Explosion

St_D_ExoticMatter.rawDesc: Gains 1 stack of <color=yellow>Exotic Matter</color> when casting a <color=yellow>Memory</color> or using <color=yellow>Flicker</color>. Your next <color=yellow>basic attack</color> consumes all stacks to create an explosion, dealing {0} <color=yellow>Light damage</color> per stack to enemies. Can hold up to {1} stacks.
St_D_ExoticMatter.description: Gains 1 stack of <color=yellow>Exotic Matter</color> when casting a <color=yellow>Memory</color> or using <color=yellow>Flicker</color>. Your next <color=yellow>basic attack</color> consumes all stacks to create an explosion, dealing <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>125%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light damage</color> per stack to enemies. Can hold up to 4 stacks.
St_D_ExoticMatter.name: Exotic Matter
St_D_ExoticMatter.lore:
Common sense is indeed a narrow window, don't you think?
If you hadn't seen this matter firsthand, might you have dismissed it as just a beautiful story, like stars in the night sky?

St_R_StaticDischarge.description:
<color=yellow>Hold</color> to charge up static, gaining 40<sprite=5> Armor. When released, detonate the static to deal <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>150%</color><sprite=5>–<sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>780%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light Damage</color> to enemies based on charge time, knocking them back and reducing their <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> by 60% for 2 seconds. The gained Armor disappears 1 seconds after the static detonates.

Charging for 1 seconds maximizes the damage and area of effect.
St_R_StaticDischarge.rawDesc:
<color=yellow>Hold</color> to charge up static, gaining {0} Armor. When released, detonate the static to deal {1}–{2} <color=yellow>Light Damage</color> to enemies based on charge time, knocking them back and reducing their <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> by {3} for {4} seconds. The gained Armor disappears {5} seconds after the static detonates.

Charging for {6} seconds maximizes the damage and area of effect.
St_R_StaticDischarge.name: Static Discharge

St_D_PrismaticEyes.description: Increases <color=yellow>Attack Speed</color> by 20%<sprite=5>. While you can't perform <color=yellow>basic attacks</color> yourself, a <color=yellow>Book</color> automatically performs <color=yellow>basic attacks</color> on the nearest enemy to Bismuth, dealing <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>70%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>additional damage</color>.
St_D_PrismaticEyes.rawDesc: Increases <color=yellow>Attack Speed</color> by {0}. While you can't perform <color=yellow>basic attacks</color> yourself, a <color=yellow>Book</color> automatically performs <color=yellow>basic attacks</color> on the nearest enemy to Bismuth, dealing {1} <color=yellow>additional damage</color>.
St_D_PrismaticEyes.name: Prismatic Vision
St_D_PrismaticEyes.lore:
When the girl opens her eyes, the old book begins to read the world. 

She sits quietly, gazing at the world beyond its pages. 
The book writes the next line of the story, and as each sentence follows the last, 
the world moves as the book wishes and as the girl wishes. 

The girl is overjoyed to finally see her own story unfold.

St_E_FinalExplosion.description: Gain 25%<sprite=5> <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> for 2 seconds, then sacrifice 40% of my maximum health to trigger a powerful explosion. Enemies caught in the explosion take <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>850%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light Damage</color> and are <color=yellow>Stunned</color> for 2.5 seconds. If already dead or killed by the sacrifice, <color=yellow>Explosion Damage</color> is increased by 150%.
St_E_FinalExplosion.rawDesc: Gain {0} <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> for {1} seconds, then sacrifice {2} of my maximum health to trigger a powerful explosion. Enemies caught in the explosion take {3} <color=yellow>Light Damage</color> and are <color=yellow>Stunned</color> for {4} seconds. If already dead or killed by the sacrifice, <color=yellow>Explosion Damage</color> is increased by {5}.
St_E_FinalExplosion.name: Final Explosion
St_E_FinalExplosion.lore:
The encirclement of the Order of the Sacred Flame tightened without a single gap.
Their holy flames denied even the deepest alley its darkness.
Cornered at a dead end, the Lucid Sect member finally stopped.

But instead of fear, a strange, ecstatic smile crossed his face.
He looked down at the knights closing in on him as if they were pitiful insects.

"You think... this is the end? Do you truly believe you can judge me with that false god's arrogant little flame?"

He closed his eyes and focused all his senses.
Beyond the clamor of reality, he heard it—the gentle whisper of the dream world,
the Rapids he had longed for.

Now, it was time to abandon everything and depart.
He opened his eyes once more to bid a final farewell to reality.

"Farewell! You blind flames... this worthless flesh... and this wretched world!"

His body began to flicker violently, taking on an otherworldly hue.
A prayer—the most fervent and desperate offering to his god.

"Lord Primus! This lowly servant offers... everything I am... to you now!"

His final cry reduced his very existence to a handful of dust,
becoming a magnificent final explosion that consumed everything.


— Memory trace from a corpse in a ruined village

St_R_BoneCrusher.description:
Become <color=yellow>Unstoppable</color> and <color=yellow>dash</color> forward until hitting a wall. Deal <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>135%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>damage</color> to enemies you hit and drag them along. Upon hitting a wall, unleash a shockwave that deals <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>420%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>damage</color> and <color=yellow>stuns</color> for 1.5 seconds.
Gain a <color=yellow>Barrier</color> equal to 20%<sprite=5> of your <color=yellow>Maximum Health</color>, which disappears 3 seconds after the dash ends.
St_R_BoneCrusher.rawDesc:
Become <color=yellow>Unstoppable</color> and <color=yellow>dash</color> forward until hitting a wall. Deal {0} <color=yellow>damage</color> to enemies you hit and drag them along. Upon hitting a wall, unleash a shockwave that deals {1} <color=yellow>damage</color> and <color=yellow>stuns</color> for {2} seconds.
Gain a <color=yellow>Barrier</color> equal to {3} of your <color=yellow>Maximum Health</color>, which disappears {4} seconds after the dash ends.
St_R_BoneCrusher.name: Bone Crusher

St_Q_Discipline.description: Dash toward the target and slam your hammer, dealing <sprite=2><color=#FF8A2D>125%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light damage</color> to enemies and triggering 50% <color=yellow>attack effects</color>. Each time you <color=yellow>attack</color> an enemy, the <color=yellow>cooldown</color> is <color=yellow>reduced</color> by 8%.
St_Q_Discipline.rawDesc: Dash toward the target and slam your hammer, dealing {0} <color=yellow>Light damage</color> to enemies and triggering {1} <color=yellow>attack effects</color>. Each time you <color=yellow>attack</color> an enemy, the <color=yellow>cooldown</color> is <color=yellow>reduced</color> by {2}.
St_Q_Discipline.name: Discipline
St_Q_Discipline.lore:
Heretic, why do you flee?
My mace simply leads lost sheep back to the righteous path. No one escapes this teaching. If the price of learning is broken bones, then that is the price that must be paid.

St_Q_Laceration.description:
Each basic attack alternates Laceration's form between <color=#f28a8a>Red Form</color> and <color=#8ab2f2>Blue Form</color>. When this skill is cast, it unleashes a different effect depending on the current form.

<color=#f28a8a>Red Form:</color> Dash a short distance, slashing enemies in a narrow area for <sprite=2><color=#FF8A2D>155%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Dark damage</color> and triggering <color=yellow>attack effects</color>. When you hit an enemy for the first time, reduce <color=yellow>cooldown</color> by 35% seconds.

<color=#8ab2f2>Blue Form:</color> Leap into the air to become briefly <color=yellow>Invulnerable</color>, then swing your blade to deal <sprite=2><color=#FF8A2D>200%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Dark damage</color> and trigger <color=yellow>attack effects</color> to all nearby enemies.
St_Q_Laceration.rawDesc:
Each basic attack alternates Laceration's form between <color=#f28a8a>Red Form</color> and <color=#8ab2f2>Blue Form</color>. When this skill is cast, it unleashes a different effect depending on the current form.

<color=#f28a8a>Red Form:</color> Dash a short distance, slashing enemies in a narrow area for {0} <color=yellow>Dark damage</color> and triggering <color=yellow>attack effects</color>. When you hit an enemy for the first time, reduce <color=yellow>cooldown</color> by {1} seconds.

<color=#8ab2f2>Blue Form:</color> Leap into the air to become briefly <color=yellow>Invulnerable</color>, then swing your blade to deal {2} <color=yellow>Dark damage</color> and trigger <color=yellow>attack effects</color> to all nearby enemies.
St_Q_Laceration.name: Laceration
St_Q_Laceration.lore:
Attack or avoid, but the result is the same.
Only your movement takes a different form.

St_E_AntiGravity.description: Reverses gravity in the target location, lifting all enemies within the range for 1.6 seconds. Then, slams them down, dealing <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>400%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>damage</color>.
St_E_AntiGravity.rawDesc: Reverses gravity in the target location, lifting all enemies within the range for {0} seconds. Then, slams them down, dealing {1} <color=yellow>damage</color>.
St_E_AntiGravity.name: Anti-Gravity
St_E_AntiGravity.lore:
Our master, Lord Erebos, simply wished to please Lady Nyx.

When he lightly stomped his foot in the starry forest, steadfast mountain ranges would rise and float like pebbles, suspended by a thread. With a single gesture of his hand, the earth would split apart and rise again, creating new landscapes. Our master would laugh like a child at these magnificent sights. Thet power that shook the heavens was nothing more than a dazzling proof of love meant for one alone.

Yet was I the only one who saw the cold shadow cross Lady Nyx's face in those moments?

What shone in her eyes was not joy, but awe and... a fierce spark of jealousy she could not conceal.


- Memory trace of a nameless night spirit.

St_C_BeamOfLight.shortDescription: Enemy Light damage and ally healing
St_C_BeamOfLight.description: Channels a beam at the enemy over 1.7<sprite=5> seconds, dealing <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>507%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light damage</color> per second and <color=yellow>healing</color> the nearby ally with the lowest Health percentage by <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>73%</color><sprite=5> per second.
St_C_BeamOfLight.rawDesc: Channels a beam at the enemy over {0} seconds, dealing {1} <color=yellow>Light damage</color> per second and <color=yellow>healing</color> the nearby ally with the lowest Health percentage by {2} per second.
St_C_BeamOfLight.name: Beam of Light
St_C_BeamOfLight.lore:
-- Experiment Log, Year 3, Day 20 of Month 1
-- Author: Carrier Bayonet
-- Research Subject: Beam of Light


Subject: Young widow. Severe burns from face to shoulders. Infected wound on cheekbone.
Result: Cheekbone infection visibly reduced. Burns appear slightly faded.

Subject: Boy. Open wounds on back from whipping.
Result: Back wounds healing well. Boy claims his "thieving habit" is now "cured" and demands to be released.

Subject: Jeff (the infamous murderer). Gunshot wounds to both ankles and wrists.
Result: Complained of intense head pain, then a small "pop" sound was heard before he passed out.
Note: Still breathing but remains unconscious.


P.S. His Majesty King Rojit has provided 10 additional death row inmates. Much research remains on this beam, but one thing is certain: this power of dreams will save many lives.

St_L_SpectreBullet.shortDescription: Attack effect, Dream Dust on kill
St_L_SpectreBullet.description: Fires a Spectral Bullet at the target enemy, dealing <sprite=2><color=#FF8A2D>300%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>damage</color> and triggering <color=yellow>attack effects</color>. If this damage <color=yellow>kills</color> an enemy, gain 5<sprite=5> <color=yellow>Dream Dust</color>.
St_L_SpectreBullet.rawDesc: Fires a Spectral Bullet at the target enemy, dealing {0} <color=yellow>damage</color> and triggering <color=yellow>attack effects</color>. If this damage <color=yellow>kills</color> an enemy, gain {1} <color=yellow>Dream Dust</color>.
St_L_SpectreBullet.name: Spectral Bullet

St_U_HerWorld.description:
Turn into a <color=yellow>Black Hole</color> for 7 seconds. All enemies are pulled towards the Black Hole, and enemies in contact with it take <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>500%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light damage</color> per second. At the end of its duration, the Black Hole explodes, dealing <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>1,200%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light damage</color> to all nearby enemies and <color=yellow>stunning</color> them for 2.5 seconds.

In the Black Hole state, gain 120<sprite=5> <color=yellow>Armor</color> and become immune to death.
St_U_HerWorld.rawDesc:
Turn into a <color=yellow>Black Hole</color> for {0} seconds. All enemies are pulled towards the Black Hole, and enemies in contact with it take {1} <color=yellow>Light damage</color> per second. At the end of its duration, the Black Hole explodes, dealing {2} <color=yellow>Light damage</color> to all nearby enemies and <color=yellow>stunning</color> them for {3} seconds.

In the Black Hole state, gain {4} <color=yellow>Armor</color> and become immune to death.
St_U_HerWorld.name: Her World
St_U_HerWorld.lore:
Nyx, the brightest star in the eternal night sky,
My soul's muse and my goddess.

I tear out the heart of my power and offer it to you.
Create your own realm, a kingdom of darkness and silence.

My existence is driven by one desire:
for you to remain the center of my universe...


- Memory trace of Erebos's vow to Nyx.

St_E_Blink.description: <color=yellow>Teleports</color> a short distance and deals <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>244%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Fire damage</color> to nearby enemies. <color=yellow>Cooldown</color> is reduced by 13% for each enemy hit.
St_E_Blink.rawDesc: <color=yellow>Teleports</color> a short distance and deals {0} <color=yellow>Fire damage</color> to nearby enemies. <color=yellow>Cooldown</color> is reduced by {1} for each enemy hit.
St_E_Blink.name: Blink
St_E_Blink.lore:
Hunting Journal
Year x of Rojit's Rule, Day xx of Month x, Weather: Cloudy
Hunting Location: Hising Forest
Today's Harvest: Some wild strawberries
Whenever I see something burning, it pulls me back to that day.
My wife, suddenly engulfed in flames, disappeared from sight.

It happened in an instant. She turned to ashes, lost in a blue flame so bright it made my eyes sting.

I checked every bullet and pouch of gunpowder, but nothing was missing. That fire wasn't normal. No smoke, no heat, just quick destruction.

Today, while watching the bowman through the scope, I discovered something.

The Lucid bastards use blue flames.

...

I need more information.

To bring my wife back, I must be careful. Now's the time to swallow my boiling vengeance.

St_D_HeartOfThePack.rawDesc: Whenever Nachia heals herself or an ally, grants a <color=yellow>Barrier</color>, or applies a <color=yellow>buff</color>, she also grants <color=yellow>Bond</color> to the target. The next <color=yellow>basic attack</color> from a target with <color=yellow>Bond</color> is empowered, creating an <color=yellow>explosion</color> that deals {0} <color=yellow>Light damage</color> to enemies.
St_D_HeartOfThePack.description: Whenever Nachia heals herself or an ally, grants a <color=yellow>Barrier</color>, or applies a <color=yellow>buff</color>, she also grants <color=yellow>Bond</color> to the target. The next <color=yellow>basic attack</color> from a target with <color=yellow>Bond</color> is empowered, creating an <color=yellow>explosion</color> that deals <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>140%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light damage</color> to enemies.
St_D_HeartOfThePack.name: Heart of the Pack
St_D_HeartOfThePack.lore: They say that when Nachia touches a spirit, it breathes with her breath for a moment. As long as that warmth lingers, the spirit glows with the same light as the forest guardian.

St_R_NaturesWhisper.description: Command all of Nachia's summons to move to the target location or attack the target enemy. Increases <color=yellow>Attack Speed</color> of Nachia and all her summons by 18%<sprite=5> for 3 seconds.
St_R_NaturesWhisper.rawDesc: Command all of Nachia's summons to move to the target location or attack the target enemy. Increases <color=yellow>Attack Speed</color> of Nachia and all her summons by {0} for {1} seconds.
St_R_NaturesWhisper.name: Nature's Whisper
St_R_NaturesWhisper.lore:
No words are needed between Nachia and her spirits. With just a sad sigh or a determined look, the entire forest carries her will.
Her gentle whisper then leads her children straight to the hearts of her enemies.

St_D_DoubleTap.rawDesc: Increases Attack Damage by {0} and Critical Strike Chance by {1}. After using a <color=yellow>Memory</color> or <color=yellow>Nimble Dodge</color>, your next <color=yellow>basic attack</color> fires twice.
St_D_DoubleTap.description: Increases Attack Damage by 5<sprite=5> and Critical Strike Chance by 20%<sprite=5>. After using a <color=yellow>Memory</color> or <color=yellow>Nimble Dodge</color>, your next <color=yellow>basic attack</color> fires twice.
St_D_DoubleTap.name: Double Tap
St_D_DoubleTap.lore:
Lacerta has never lost a bet.
One shot for the coin, another for the beer in the opponent's hand.

St_C_Starfall.description: Calls down 4<sprite=5> falling stars on nearby random enemies. Each falling star deals <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>70%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light damage</color>.
St_C_Starfall.rawDesc: Calls down {0} falling stars on nearby random enemies. Each falling star deals {1} <color=yellow>Light damage</color>.
St_C_Starfall.name: Starfall

St_QR_Innocence.shortDescription: Area Light damage, reduces Movement Speed
St_QR_Innocence.description: Fires 3<sprite=5> soul missiles at nearby enemies. Each missile explodes, dealing <sprite=1><color=#16D7FF>120%</color><sprite=5> <color=yellow>Light Damage</color> to enemies and slowing their <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> by 60% for 1 seconds.
St_QR_Innocence.rawDesc: Fires {0} soul missiles at nearby enemies. Each missile explodes, dealing {1} <color=yellow>Light Damage</color> to enemies and slowing their <color=yellow>Movement Speed</color> by {2} for {3} seconds.
St_QR_Innocence.name: Pure Soul
St_QR_Innocence.lore:
Once upon a time, there was a very small girl. 
Whenever she saw bad people, her heart would ache. 

So, she would take the shining pieces of her own heart and toss them to the villains. 
Whenever that pure light touched someone, even the worst of hearts would grow gentle. 

The villains would suddenly realize all the wrong they had done, and with tears in their eyes, they would drift off into a deep, peaceful sleep.

St_R_Frostbite.description: Your next 2 <color=yellow>attacks</color> are faster and empowered. St_E_FlameJet.lore:
Hunting Journal
2nd Year of Rojit's Rule, Day xx of Month x, Weather: Clear
Hunting Location: Igni Wetlands
Today's Harvest: A pocketful of nettles

There are rules I always follow when I go hunting in the Igni Wetlands.

1. Be cautious if you spot claw marks on mangrove roots.

2. If those marks aren't covered in moss, steer clear of that direction.

3. If you see smoke in the distance or smoldering embers on charred trees, head home immediately.

I made these rules after what I saw through my scope last summer. Some fool tugged on a half-scorched Kalimberry vine and came face to face with a monstrous Barasus.

I don't think I've seen flames that big, not even at the Royal Guard's fire weapon demonstrations.

The cowards at Arcanum called this theory "unacceptably dangerous."

They failed to grasp the elegance of the theory where matter, put under extreme conditions, produces the most explosive results. I am simply proving my hypothesis.

St_C_MassProtection.name: Mass Protection
St_C_MassProtection.lore:
Every time the Moonlight Council convenes, we extend this great barrier. It is a solemn act, signifying that the Society exists solely in the pursuit of truth, under the profound and absolute belief that we must not interfere in any affairs of the outside world.

Lately, however, I have felt a strange dissonance and a cold realization within this absolute silence. This perfect peace so thoroughly erases the cries of countless lives fading away outside, and our "neutrality" is merely a noble privilege gained at the cost of remaining silent before their suffering.

For some reason, I am reminded of that child's face. Aurena. I realize that the logic we used to block her "dangerous" inquiries bears an uncanny resemblance to the logic we now use with this barrier, shutting out the "dangerous" chaos of the world.

Are we truly "protecting" the truth? Or are we merely "protecting" ourselves from everything we have given up trying to understand?

I wonder if this sacred protection ultimately serves not our sublime neutrality, but our deepest cowardice. I still do not know the answer.

If your Health is below {3}, healing is increased by {4}. Triggers <color=yellow>attack effects</color> on the first target hit. Slashes faster with higher <color=yellow>Attack Speed</color>.
St_U_Hysteria.name: Hysteria
St_U_Hysteria.lore:
The nightmare's corruption was not a sudden event. It seeped in slowly, like poison, through the deep wounds he received while protecting the forest.

First, his horns twisted into demonic shapes, even though they once marked him as a forest guardian. Then came his nails. From hands that once nurtured life, black claws grew, ready to tear everything apart. The warmth and mischievous playfulness in his eyes disappeared, replaced by the red light of a starving beast. It was as if his original purpose was being both denied and mocked.

As his reason faded and pure pain and fury took hold of his body, he let out one final, broken breath.

"Nachia... I'm sorry..."

But those words reached no one, fading away at the very moment the last spark of the being called "Belphomet" was extinguished.

This was both his last cry and the first howl of the nightmare that took over his body.
